text: is a Japanese athlete. He is best known as an Equestrian who competed in two Summer Olympic Games.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), Tsunekazu Takeda ; retrieved 2012-7-26. He is the current President of the Japanese Olympic Committee.Nippon Olympic Committee (NOC), Tsunekazu Takeda ==Early life== Takeda was born on November 1, 1947 in Tokyo. He was the third son of Prince Tsuneyoshi Takeda and his great-grandfather was Emperor Meiji.Reuters.com, "Olympics-Japan chief Takeda elected to IOC," July 27, 2012; retrieved 2012-7-27. He graduated from Keio University in 1970 with a degree in law. ==Career== Takeda was a member of the Japanese team in the 1972 Summer Olympics at Munich and the 1976 Summer Olympics at Montreal. He was a competitor in the All Japan Equestrian Championships in 1969, 1975, 1977, 1978 and 1982. In 2001, he became president of the Japanese Olympic Committee. He is also an Executive Board member on the Olympic Council of Asia. In July 2012, he was elected to be a member of the International Olympic Committee (IOC).Olympic.org, "IOC Session votes on new members and Executive Board positions"; retrieved 2012-7-26. ==Related pages== * Sports in Japan * Japan at the Olympics ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:1972 Summer Olympics Category:1976 Summer Olympics Category:International Olympic Committee Category:Olympians for Japan Category:Japanese show jumping riders Category:Sportspeople from Tokyo Category:Olympic equestrians for Japan
title: Tsunekazu Takeda
